definition: to beat time/to mark rhythm on drum or clapper boards
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

sentences.english: He beat time on the accelerator .
sentences.chinese: 他用腳在加速器上打拍子。

sentences.english: Flat clappers made of bone or wood originally used by the end man in a minstrel show.
sentences.chinese: 打拍者巡遊演出中站在一端敲擊骨制或木製響板的人。

sentences.english: You beat time and I'll play.
With his baton the conductor was beating time.
sentences.chinese: 指揮用指揮棒着打拍節。

sentences.english: Now when I play CDs, you hum and tap your feet.
sentences.chinese: 現在我放cd盤，你一邊呼，一邊用腳打拍子了。

sentences.english: He beat time with his fingers.
Follow me and clap your hands according to rhythm.
She tapped her feet in time to the music.
sentences.chinese: 她用肢合着音樂輕輕地打拍子。

definition: to notate music/to write a score
(music) fingering/(TCM) manipulation of acupuncture needles/(keyboard) typing technique/(dance) hand movements/(painting) finger method
